oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Helmet of Pvt. Henry Edwards Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This U.S. Model 1917 helmet is in excellent condition except for missing chin strap. Marked on reverse rim is 271/ZD that indicates batch and source of the steel used in making the helmet. The helmet belonged to Pvt. Henry E. Phillips of Oliver Springs. Phillips never saw combat. The Model 1917 helmet was the standard for most American soldiers, however, some units also received British Brodie helmets. The two designs were very similar.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
